recording_restarted.Description: Whether the recording was restarted due to a technical issue. This applies to one participant, for whom the experiment crashed partway through.

recording_interrupted.Description: Whether the recording was interrupted. In this case, the recording crashed partway through the experiment, and was continued in a separate brainvision file. Some data is missing from the period during which the recording was restarted. The files in this BIDS repository are joined end-to-end into one EEG file. This problem occurred for one participant.

age.Description: Age of the participant at time of testing

hand_index.Description: Laterality Quotient from the Short Form of the Edinburgh Handedness Inventory (from -100 [completely left] to 100 [completely right]).

other_lang.Description: A semicolon-separated list of languages that the participant speaks in addition to German.

other_lang_level.Description: A semicolon-separated list of the CEFR level to which the participant speaks each language listed in other_lang. The order of entries in the list matches that in other_lang.

multiling_read.Description: Whether the participant often reads in a language, in addition to German.

other_lang_read.Description: A semicolon-separated list of languages that the participant reads, in addition to German.

head_circum.Description: Circumference of the head, as measured for the EEG cap.

tired.Description: A rating on how tired the participant feels (made after the experiment).

sleep_h.Description: How many hours of sleep the participant had last night.

caffeine.Description: Whether the participant reported drinking caffeine in the last 6 hours.

caf_drink.Description: A semicolon-separated list of which caffeinated drinks the participant reported drinking in the last 6 hours.

strategy.Description: A self-reported description of the strategy used by the participant during the experiment ('no' or missing data correspond to no self-reported strategy).

inner_speech.Description: Whether the participant reported internally pronouncing the letters that were presented.
